definition: to halt/to stay/to be stationed (of troops, diplomats etc)

sentences.english: The country has around 4, 250 troops in the country.
sentences.chinese: 德國目前在阿富汗約有4250名駐軍。

sentences.english: Any member of the Macao Garrison who breaches military discipline shall be subject to disciplinary sanction.
sentences.chinese: 澳門駐軍人員違反軍隊紀律的，給予紀律處分。

sentences.english: The Spartans withdrew their garrison from the Athenian Acropolis, and democracy was restored.
sentences.chinese: 斯巴達人從雅典衛城撤回駐軍，民主得以恢復。

sentences.english: Even the Thai-Cambodian troops on both sides are at daggers drawn as people think.
sentences.chinese: 就連泰柬兩邊的駐軍也沒有人們想象的那樣劍拔弩張。

sentences.english: During the American Revolution, the British moved their 13)garrison to Mackinac Island.
sentences.chinese: 在美國獨立戰爭期間，英國人在麥基諾島駐軍。

sentences.english: Buzzers have the ability to clear garrisoned structures.
sentences.chinese: 蜂羣擁有清除駐軍建築得能力。

sentences.english: The island has a large military garrison.
sentences.chinese: 島上有大量的韓方駐軍。

sentences.english: At that time, it was the most westerly frontier military garrison in China.
sentences.chinese: 在那個時候，它是最西風邊境駐軍在中國。

sentences.english: The wheat garrison forces is lately wild, the sword point keeps a Jing sun pass.
sentences.chinese: 阿麥駐軍新野，劍尖直指靖陽關口。

sentences.english: In retaliation, the Japanese attacked and war commenced.
sentences.chinese: 爲了報復，日軍襲擊中國駐軍，中日戰爭爆發。

sentences.english: The Japanese garrison on Wake surrendered at the end of World War II.
sentences.chinese: 關於日本駐軍投降叫醒在第二次世界大戰結束。

sentences.english: The white flag was run up;the post had surrendered.
sentences.chinese: 白旗高高掛起，駐軍業已投降。

sentences.english: Obejctive To explore level of intelligence quotient(IQ) of children of garrison in coastal area of Fujian and its influential factors.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討沿海駐軍幹部子女智商水平現狀及影響因素。

sentences.english: Let us sell the field on which Hannibal is encamped.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們把漢尼拔駐軍的營地賣了吧。

sentences.english: Here are some of the recommendations from NRDC and the Garrison Institute.
sentences.chinese: 以下是一些NRDC和駐軍研究所提出的部分建議。

sentences.english: Third we antagonize the situation by having troops stationed in both south Korea and japan.
sentences.chinese: 第三呢，我們在南韓和日本駐軍，導致了這個局面。

definition: to dispatch (sb) in an official capacity/to be posted (as an ambassador, foreign correspondent etc)
commander-in-chief/top military commander for a country or theater of operations
United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)
military aircraft/secret plan/Privy Council during the Qing dynasty
